intro: Antrocaryon klaineanum, commonly known as the African wild fig, is a deciduous tree native to the savannas of Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are important for both wildlife and local human populations. It often grows in open habitats and can tolerate seasonal droughts. Its ecological role includes providing shelter and food for various animal species.
